result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

Defendant stands Mute and Court enters NOT GUILTY pleas.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

4:24 PM Defendant Geoffry Ryan Norfleet in court.  Attorney Teuta Jonuzi on behalf of Attorney Tracey A. Wood appeared by video for Geoffry Ryan Norfleet.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Mutchler calls witness Officer Maccbe who is sworn and testifies during direct exam.
Witness identified the defendant in court.
Exhibit P#1 copy of the complaint is filed.
Objections by Atty Jonuzi as to Exhibit P#1. Overruled.
BY THE COURT: Exhibit P#1 is received by the court.
Cross exam by Atty Jonuzi.
No further questions. No further witnesses.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Request to Appear Remotely filed by Atty Tracey Wood (sent to Br 1 Judge on 08/17/22 sp)

Defendant Geoffry Ryan Norfleet not in court.  Attorney Brendan Delany on Zoom, for Atty Wood, for today's hearing. Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard are 22CF-371, 22TR-1560 and 22TR-1561.

9:09 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Neither Defendant or Atty Wood appear today.

Court did approve party to appear remotely.
Matter will be recalled shortly, to give them time. 

9:26 AM Atty Delany appears by Zoom.
Court will take a 5 minute break for Atty Delany to see where his client is. Matter will be recalled.

9:36 AM Cases are recalled.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for an initial appearance.
Defendant is not present.

Atty Delany addresses the Court, Defendant misunderstood and didn't think he had to appear today, requests an adjournment.

BY THE COURT:
Matter will be adjourned for one week. 

Atty Delany requests the flexibility. Court reminds Defense to request remote appearances.
Defendant should be here in person unless he has a good reason.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
